articles.headline: Fox Leaders Wanted to Break From Trump but Struggled to Make It Happen
articles.snippet: Executives and top hosts found themselves in a bind after Donald Trump began pushing unfounded claims about election fraud, court filings show.
articles.abstract: Executives and top hosts found themselves in a bind after Donald Trump began pushing unfounded claims about election fraud, court filings show.
articles.lead_paragraph: Five days after a pro-Trump mob attacked the U.S. Capitol, a board member of the Fox Corporation, Anne Dias, reached out to Rupert and Lachlan Murdoch with an urgent plea.

articles.headline: As Dollar Stores Proliferate, Some Communities Say No
articles.snippet: More than 70 proposed dollar stores have been rejected since 2019, a report shows. It’s a small number compared with those that opened but evidence of opposition to the industry.
articles.abstract: More than 70 proposed dollar stores have been rejected since 2019, a report shows. It’s a small number compared with those that opened but evidence of opposition to the industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

articles.headline: A Shifting Mood on Crime Propelled Chicago’s Leading Candidate for Mayor
articles.snippet: Paul Vallas, who emerged as the front-runner with a tough-on-crime message, will face Brandon Johnson, a progressive county commissioner, in an April runoff.
articles.abstract: Paul Vallas, who emerged as the front-runner with a tough-on-crime message, will face Brandon Johnson, a progressive county commissioner, in an April runoff.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — When Paul Vallas ran for mayor of Chicago four years ago, it did not go well. He finished in a distant ninth place, winning only 5 percent of the vote and barely registering as an electoral afterthought.

articles.headline: Living With Mom and Dad While Figuring Out a Financial Exit Plan
articles.snippet: Some young adults who returned home to save money and figure out their careers are calculating what it will take for them to leave again.
articles.abstract: Some young adults who returned home to save money and figure out their careers are calculating what it will take for them to leave again.
articles.lead_paragraph: Nicole Solero moved out of her parents’ home in Orlando, Fla., after she graduated from a community college in 2019. She worked as a freelance graphic designer in a small town in South Florida, but she felt lonely and depressed working remotely while her roommate frequently traveled for work. Ms. Solero decided to move back in with her parents.

articles.headline: Where Digital Payments, Even for a 10-Cent Chai, Are Colossal in Scale
articles.snippet: India’s homegrown instant payment system has remade commerce and pulled millions into the formal economy.
articles.abstract: India’s homegrown instant payment system has remade commerce and pulled millions into the formal economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: The little QR code is ubiquitous across India’s vastness.
articles.byline: By Mujib Mashal and Hari Kumar

articles.headline: Eli Lilly Says It Will Cut the Price of Insulin
articles.snippet: The company also trumpeted an existing policy that caps monthly out-of-pocket cost for its lifesaving products at $35.
articles.abstract: The company also trumpeted an existing policy that caps monthly out-of-pocket cost for its lifesaving products at $35.
articles.lead_paragraph: The drugmaker Eli Lilly and Company said on Wednesday that it would significantly reduce the sticker prices of several of its lifesaving insulin products that are used by diabetes patients and whose prices Lilly has repeatedly increased in the past.

articles.headline: Tesla Offers a New ‘Master Plan’ but Few Big Revelations
articles.snippet: Elon Musk confirmed his car company would build a factory in Mexico and said it was working on more affordable vehicles. But he did not reveal a new model, disappointing some investors.
articles.abstract: Elon Musk confirmed his car company would build a factory in Mexico and said it was working on more affordable vehicles. But he did not reveal a new model, disappointing some investors.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tesla said on Wednesday that it would build a factory in Mexico to manufacture an electric vehicle that would be significantly more affordable than any of the cars it sold now. But the company disappointed investors who were expecting it to make big announcements about new products and strategies.

articles.headline: Tech Is Allowing Businesses to Overcharge You in Tips
articles.snippet: Payment apps and touch screens have made it easy for merchants to ask us for preset gratuity amounts. We don’t need to succumb to the pressure.
articles.abstract: Payment apps and touch screens have made it easy for merchants to ask us for preset gratuity amounts. We don’t need to succumb to the pressure.
articles.lead_paragraph: You might be wondering why I, a tech columnist, would write about tipping. The reason is that tipping is no longer just a socioeconomic and ethical issue about the livelihoods of service workers.
